ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: recorded lectures, PSETs and canvas quizes, and zoom office hours with the ULAs and professor

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned basic statistical concepts, including how to create various types of linear models and perform basic statistical analysis using a computer program called MINITAB.
Learned about various basic statistics concepts and how to apply them to sample datasets.
I gained a better understanding of introductory statistics and how to practice this in R

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: Despite the fact that they were recorded, I felt the lectures were pretty engaging. The class has a strong support system available (piazza, many office hour times, good ULAs). 
Weaknesses: The class was entirely self paced. While this is nice sometimes, it also got increasingly difficult to motivate myself to watch the lectures as the semester went on. Lectures were also occasionally posted 1-2 days after the scheduled class date.

The course was very well presented and the lectures were engaging and informative. I felt that the quizzes for every lecture were the strongest points of this class as they really helped me retain the important info from each lecture and were an added incentive for me to pay attention and take notes, as well as highlighting the main takeaways from each lecture. I also felt that the option to retake the quizzes once was really great. Feedback on homeworks was also good. I didn't really like the external tool used to submit homework though because we had to individually select every page that corresponded to every part of every question, something I found just a bit tedious.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The ULAs and professor were responsive and easy to reach via piazza or office hours despite everything being virtual. I think this course was well adapted to remote learning overall.

This class was definitely the class that translated best to the online format as the recorded lectures and the powerpoints used in the lectures suited my style of learning. The video lectures weren't too long and were actually very engaging and well-formated. I enjoyed how I could play the lectures at faster speeds or rewind when necessary. The class was completely asynchronous but there were many office hours at various times throughout the week.
the recordings were great - I think this class was already set up pre-pandemic well, and it was easy to transition to COVID due to its nature of being online originally

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to a student looking for a basic introduction to statistics.
Yes, it is a great intro to statistics and was actually a rather enjoyable experience in terms of both the topics covered and how the class is structured.
